description: From Middle English reuþful, reuthful, reowthful, equivalent to ruth +‎ -ful.

adjectives.description: ruthful (comparative more ruthful, superlative most ruthful)

entries.meaning: Full of sorrow; sorrowful; woeful; rueful.
Full of ruth or pity; merciful; compassionate.
examples: Then he bestowed robes of honour on the nurses wet and dry and said to them, "Be ye ruthful over them and rear them after the goodliest fashion."
